title: 100 water and climate projects for Africa
summary: Strengthening adaptation in the basins of lakes, rivers and associated aquifers through the incubation of projects in Africa
description: Partners of the projects are providing technical assistance to speed up the pace of development of high quality water and climate projects submitted to donors of the climate finance. It targets projects mobilizing effective adaptation measures, and in particular non-infrastructural solutions: (1) Adaptation strategy and action plan (impact / climate vulnerability study, adaptation strategy, flood/drought plan, demand management plan and water supply development, Nature-Based Solutions and other "no-regret" measures); (2) Capacity and knowledge building (i.e. hydro-meteorological network, Water Information System -WIS, warning system, hydroclimatic modeling); (3) Governance (legal and institutional framework, training of staff from basin organizations on climate issues, establishment/strengthening of basin committees, association with basin adaptation planning); (4) Adequate funding (sustainable financing mechanisms in line with the polluter/user pays principles and cost recovery, cost/effectiveness analysis of the planned adaptation actions). A leverage effect from 1 to 100 is expected from the modest budget required for this incubation to the budget required for project implementation. Join the initiative! You can submit project proposals, provide technical assistance or financial support!

title: 24/7 Carbon-Free Energy
summary: A global group of companies, policymakers, investors, and organizations on a mission to realize a 24/7 Carbon-Free Energy future for all: every kilowatt-hour of electricity demand with Carbon-Free Energy sources, every hour, every day, everywhere.

title: 4/1000 Initiative - Soils for Food Security and Climate
summary: Provide a supportive framework and action plan in line with the SDGs to conceptualize, implement, promote, and monitor soil health and carbon actions by 2030 through increased collaboration among AFOLU stakeholders.
description: The "4 per 1000 Initiative: Soils for Food Security and Climate" was launched at COP 21 in December 2015. The Initiative carries the vision of worldwide healthy and carbon-rich soils (especially agricultural and forest soils) to combat climate change and end hunger. It promotes the natural sequestration of organic carbon in soils, and support for the most advanced scientific research in this field, globally.

title: Action towards Climate-Friendly Transport (ACT)
summary: ACT Initiative is the largest global coalition aiming to catalyse transport as an enabler of sustainable development in line with the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and the Paris Agreement
description: At the 2019 Climate Action Summit, for the first time, over 100 organisations came together in a bold, multi-pronged commitment to accelerate the decarbonisation of transport worldwide. The coalition delivers on its goals by connecting innovative approaches with integrated, long-term planning, speeding up the deployment of electric vehicles, creating a mass market for zero-emission freight vehicles, and fostering global dialogue arenas with and among the private sector. ACT is delivering results and works through four components.

title: AFOLU 2040 Regional Initiative for Central America and the Dominican Republic (AFOLU 2040)
summary: By 2030, the SICA region will restore and conserve ten million hectares of degraded lands and ecosystems, promoting sustainable and climate-adapted carbon neutrality in agriculture, forestry and other land uses by 2040.
description: The countries of the Central American Integration System (SICA) will take collective action to conserve forests; transition to low-carbon and resilient agriculture and livestock management; integrate sustainable practices, and develop a monitoring, reporting and verification (MRV) system including for agriculture.

title: African Adaptation Initiative (AAI)
summary: Enhance action on adaptation with the aim of addressing the financing gap, and implementing measures to address disaster risk reduction and resilience needs in Africa
description: In launching the AAI, African Heads of State have initiated high-level pan-African and regional dialogues, adaptation action on the ground, and cross-sector processes to strengthen collaboration across Africa. The AAI will raise awareness about climate adaptation, build and strengthen capacity, support resource mobilization for implementation, promote cooperation, and track climate action progress.

title: Airport Carbon Accreditation
summary: The aim of Airport Carbon Accreditation is to encourage and enable airports to implement best practices in carbon management and achieve emissions reductions
description: Airport Carbon Accreditation is the only voluntary global carbon management standard for airports. The aim of Airport Carbon Accreditation is to encourage and enable airports to implement best practices in carbon management and achieve emissions reductions. Airports can participate at one of four progressively stringent levels of accreditation: 1. Mapping; 2. Reduction; 3. Optimisation; and 4. Transformation. In addition, airports at Level 3 and 4 can choose to offset their residual emissions, thereby achieving Level 3+ (Neutrality) and 4+ (Transition) respectively.

title: Ambitious SIDS Climate Action
summary: Commit to the transition to renewable energy and energy efficiency targets by 2030
description: A transformative SIDS Climate Action Summit package on Sustainable Energy towards a pathway of enhanced renewable energy transition targets by 2030, which is being operationalized through the SIDS Lighthouses Initiative (LHI) and coordinated by the International Renewable Energy Agency.

title: Assessing low-Carbon Transition (ACT)
summary: Increase the collective ambition of reducing greenhouse gas emissions in strategic economic sectors by providing a corporates climate accountability framework with sectoral methodologies to assess and support companies decarbonization strategies and associated transition plans.
description: ACT provides a corporates climate accountability framework with sectoral methodologies to assess and support companies decarbonization strategies and associated transition plans. Historically developed by the French Agency for Ecological Transition in partnership with CDP and a multi stakeholders collaborative approach, ACT addresses both needs to equip the private sector to decarbonise and inform its key stakeholders to leverage. Since June 2022, ACT Initiative is hosted by the World Benchmarking Alliance.

title: Bonn Challenge
summary: The Bonn Challenge is a global goal to bring 150 million hectares of degraded and deforested landscapes into restoration by 2020 and 350 million hectares by 2030
description: The Bonn Challenge is a global goal to bring 150 million hectares of degraded and deforested landscapes into restoration by 2020 and 350 million hectares by 2030.

title: Building Efficiency Accelerator
summary: The project aims to help cities double the improvement rate of building energy efficiency by 2030 through linking global market experience with local policy action, capacity building, and range of levels of direct technical assistance for testing and scaling best practices.
description: The project aims to help cities double the improvement rate of building energy efficiency by 2030 through linking global market experience with local policy action, capacity building, and range of levels of direct technical assistance for testing and scaling best practices.

title: Business Declares
summary: Inspire, encourage and accelerate business action to address the climate, ecological and social emergency.

title: Carbon Neutral Cities Alliance (CNCA)
summary: CNCA’s mission is to mobilize transformative climate action in cities in order to achieve prosperity, social equity, resilience and better quality of life for all on a thriving planet
description: CNCA supports the leading cities to achieve their carbon neutrality targets. The Alliance does this through investing in policy development, adoption and implementation; helping cities to exert collective influence; developing governance tools for climate justice and carbon emissions; leadership training; communications support; and helping them to put people front and center.

title: CBN Expert
summary: Inspire and support SMEs to make real and positive commitments to a credible Net Zero transition, and produce Science Based target compliant plans and a commitment to deliver compliant reporting and slear action across all 3 Scope of GHG emissions.
description: CBN Expert supports a wide range of small & medium sized businesses who wish to demonstrate their commitment to NetZero.

title: Central African Forests Initiative (CAFI)
summary: Recognize and preserve the value of the forests in Central Africa to mitigate climate change, reduce poverty, and contribute to sustainable development
description: The member countries of the Central African Forest Initiative (CAFI) committed to increasing climate ambition and their NDCs by 2020 by maintaining forest cover in the region, continuing to stock approximately 70 gigatons of carbon and providing livelihoods for 60 million people by conserving the second largest tropical forest basin in the world.

title: Cities Climate Finance Leadership Alliance (CCFLA)
summary: Enable the mainstreaming of urban climate action around the world and accelerate climate-aligned capital flows to cities, becoming the leading global multi-stakeholder climate finance initiative for cities.
description: The Cities Climate Finance Leadership Alliance (CCFLA) is a multi-level and multi-stakeholder coalition aimed at closing the investment gap for urban subnational climate projects and infrastructure by 2030. CCFLA provides a platform to convene and exchange knowledge among all relevant actors dedicated to urban development, climate action, and/or financing.

title: Clean Air Fund
summary: Working towards a world where everyone can breathe clean air
description: The Clean Air Fund is a philanthropic organisation working globally to empower funders, researchers, policymakers and campaigners to deliver clean air for all.

title: Clean Air Initiative
summary: Commit to achieve air quality that is safe for populations, align climate change and air pollution policies by 2030 and scale up investments towards climate action, health and sustainable development
description: The Clean Air Initiative calls on national and subnational governments to commit to achieving air quality that is safe for citizens, and to align climate change and air pollution policies by 2030. Financial institutions commit to scale up investments to support climate action, health and sustainable development.

title: Clean Cooking Fund
summary: Scale up public and private investment in the clean cooking sector by co-financing Multi-lateral Development Banks' lending operations, catalyzing technology and business innovation, and linking incentives with verified results
description: At the United Nations 2019 Climate Summit, ESMAP launched its US$500 million Clean Cooking Fund (CCF) – the first ever such fund to scale up investments in the clean cooking sector. The fund aims to scale up public and private investments by co-financing with Multi-lateral Development Bank’s lending operations, catalyzing technology and business innovation, and linking incentives with verified results. The CCF is expected to leverage US$2 billion in investments to support a sizeable number of businesses delivering clean cooking solutions, with a view to transforming the market. The CCF was operationalized in January 2020. The first CCF project is the Energy Access Quality Improvement Project (EAQIP) in Rwanda, which is the largest World Bank financed clean cooking project in Africa to date. The EAQIP Project will expand access to clean cooking to 500,000 households across Rwanda and leverage US$30 million in public and private sector investment. Other countries in the pipeline include Uganda, Burundi, Ghana, Myanmar, Niger and Mozambique.

title: Clean Energy Corridors in Africa
summary: Transform the current fuel mix by promoting development of clean, indigenous, cost-effective renewable power options and strengthen cross-border trade of renewable power
description: The implementation of the Africa Clean Energy Corridor (ACEC) is guided by the Ministerial Communiqué that endorsed the ACEC Action Agenda in January 2014 and contributed to the development of Africa’s flagship climate action programme, the Africa Renewable Energy Initiative (AREI). Enjoying broad political support from the region, the West Africa Clean Energy Corridor (WACEC) was adopted by the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) Council of Ministers as an annex to the ECOWAS Treaty in December 2016. This was then endorsed by the Summit of ECOWAS Heads of States in June 2017. In March 2017, the African Union recommended the integration of the Clean Energy Corridors into national renewable energy and climate change agendas.

title: Climate Action 100+
summary: Corporate engagement to ask that the world’s largest corporate greenhouse gas emitters take necessary action on climate change.
description: Climate Action 100+ is a collaborative investor-led initiative, which aims to ensure that world’s largest corporate greenhouse gas emitters take necessary action on climate change.

title: Climate Action Accelerator
summary: Empowering organisations to develop and implement transition plans towards halving GHG emissions by 2030.

title: Climate Action for Jobs Initiative
summary: Countries commit to developing a just transition plan
description: National Governments to commit to formulating just transition plans which incorporate social dialogue, assessment of impacts, skills development and social protection policies to advance these conversations and enhance implementation and ambition of climate action. All countries signup to: (1) Creating mechanisms of inclusive social dialogue; (2) Assessing employment, social and economic impacts of ecological transition and green jobs potential; (3) Implementing skills development and upgrading measures; (4) Designing innovative social protection policies to protect workers, vulnerable groups in the context of more ambitious climate strategies; (5) Increasing the transfer of technology and knowledge to developing countries.

title: Climate Change Impacts on Cultural and Natural Heritage (CCICH)
summary: Bridge the gap between scientific knowledge and climate adaptation tools with informed decision-making by interested States, to facilitate and enhance, in a coordinated manner, their efforts to effectively protect cultural and natural heritage from the impacts of climate change.
description: CCICH comprises of representatives from Greece, UNESCO, UNFCCC and the WMO with the objectives to a) create an international network between the countries and international organisations supporting the initiative and other international agencies active in the protection of the cultural and natural environment from the climate change; b) create a database with best practices in this field; c) identify related know-how, information and data.

title: Climate Club
summary: An open, inclusive and ambitious high-level forum for cooperation on accelerating climate action and increasing ambition, particularly in the field of industry decarbonisation.

title: Climate Investment Platform (CIP)
summary: Clean, Affordable, Reliable and Climate-resilient development
description: A unified mechanism for governments, international organizations and private sector partnerships to support the realization of ambitious climate plans in the context of updated NDCs. The platform declutters and streamlines support from lead and partner institutions. These institutions will use the platform to provide services to governments and private sector clients in their efforts to scale-up climate resilient development including access to clean energy, with the ultimate goal to contribute to the realization of ambitious NDCs.

title: Climate Neutral Now
summary: The Climate Neutral Now Initiative encourages and supports organizations to act now in order to achieve a climate neutral world by 2050, as enshrined in the Paris Agreement.
description: Climate Neutral Now encourages all stakeholders in society to implement immediate actions to achieve a climate neutral (net zero) world by mid-century. It proposes a set of three steps: measure, reduce and contribute. Contributing currently means supporting climate action by third parties through the carbon markets, using certified carbon credits. The first two steps are compulsory, while the third is optional but encouraged. Annual reporting is required by all participants. The initiative is currently in a phase-out period and no new pledges will be accepted from August 2023 onwards, with reporting on 2023 emissions being the last accepted until mid-2024.

title: Climate Security Mechanism (CSM)
summary: The Climate Security Mechanism works with partners across and beyond the UN to advance peace-positive climate action, catalyze climate-informed approaches to peace and security, and forge partnerships with actors at all levels to exchange information and build the evidence base.
description: The Climate Security Mechanism (CSM) is a joint initiative by the United Nations Department of Political and Peacebuilding Affairs (DPPA), the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) and the United Nations Department of Peace Operations (DPO). The CSM aims to strengthen the capacity of the United Nations to systematically analyze and address the linkages between climate change, peace and security. It draws on the complementary expertise and tools of DPPA, UNDP, UNEP and DPO to work with partners across and beyond the UN to advance peace-positive climate action, catalyze climate-informed approaches to peace and security, and forge partnerships with actors at all levels to exchange information and build the evidence base. The CSM pursues these objectives by combining direct work in the field with global workstreams designed to create an enabling environment for partners. Recognizing the interlinkages between climate change, peace and security, the CSM seeks to build synergies between climate action and peace and security activities with a particular focus on gender-sensitive responses. The CSM works directly with United Nations field missions and country teams, and with regional and sub-regional organizations, to build capacity, exchange knowledge, and achieve results that support States and communities most affected by climate-related security risks.

title: Coalition for Climate Resilient Investment (CCRI)
summary: CCRI advances solutions that lead the way in driving a systemic shift to facilitate capital investment in resilient infrastructure globally
description: To date there has not been a concerted cross-industry effort that engages with climate resilience. CCRI aims to change that dynamic by convening different sectors and industries in support of creating the frameworks and tools to more efficiently price climate risks and facilitate resilience investments. The Coalition will lead the way, driving a systemic shift that facilitates greater capital investment in resilience across the world.

title: Coalition for Sustainable Energy Access (CSEA)
summary: 100% access to sufficient, affordable, modern and renewable energy by all citizens in LDCs and ODCs by 2030
description: International cooperation and public-private partnerships are crucial means to establish a more rapid and efficient deployment of renewable energy technologies. Yet, till this day, there is still no platform that can help unite the main actors in the fields of energy transition and climate finance. The Coalition for Sustainable Energy Access, jointly led by Ethiopia and Morocco and announced at the UN’s last Climate Action Summit, will attempt to bridge such gaps and introduce innovative approaches to tackling pertinent challenges related to renewable energy not covered by other initiatives and act as an intermediary between developing countries and supporting international institutions/initiatives by matchmaking them.

title: Cool Coalition
summary: Accelerate the transition towards efficient climate-friendly cooling for all to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals, the Paris Agreement goals, and the Kigali Amendment to the Montreal Protocol
description: The Cool Coalition is a global multi-stakeholder network that connects key actors from government, cities, IOs, businesses, finance, civil society to facilitate knowledge exchange, advocacy and joint action towards a rapid transition to sustainable cooling. An official outcome and transformative initiative put forward by the Secretary-General Executive Office at the 2019 UNCAS, the Coalition has 120 members that are driving change in the cooling sector globally.

title: COP28 Action Agenda on Regenerative Landscapes
summary: Catalysing a transformative shift towards regenerative and agroecological practices across global landscapes, aiming to establish resilient, sustainable food systems that benefit both nature and people.

title: Early Warnings for All (EW4All)
summary: Working to ensure that everyone on Earth is protected from hazardous weather, water, or climate events through life-saving early warning systems by the end of 2027
description: Early Warnings for All is an initiative to ensure that everyone on Earth is protected from hazardous weather, water, or climate events through life-saving early warning systems by the end of 2027. With human-induced climate change leading to more extreme weather conditions, the need for early warning systems is more crucial than ever. Systems that warn people of impending storms, floods or droughts are not a luxury but a cost-effective tool that saves lives, reduces economic losses, and provides a nearly tenfold return on investment. Early warning systems have helped decrease the number of deaths and have reduced losses and damages resulting from hazardous weather, water or climate events. But major gaps still exist, especially in small island developing states and least developed countries. The United Nations Secretary-General, António Guterres, in 2022 called for a global effort to ensure that early warning systems protect everyone on Earth by 2027.

title: EcoMobility Alliance
summary: Empower cities to achieve sustainable urban mobility
description: The EcoMobility Alliance is a network of ambitious cities, led by innovators and visionaries, supported by experts and businesses, committed to building a sustainable mobility future that is efficient, people-centered, low emission and environmentally friendly. The EcoMobility Alliance was founded in 2011 with six cities and has since grown to 23 cities from various regions of the world. Since its inception, the EcoMobility Alliance has worked to become a truly global actor by engaging a geographically diverse range of cities and partners. Cities that have joined have shown significant efforts to advance and implement sustainable urban mobility.

title: EV100
summary: Bringing together companies committed to electrifying their fleets and/or installing EV charging company-wide by 2030.
description: Companies that join EV100 are committed to driving the transition to electric vehicles on the road, leveraging corporate leadership to build market demand and establish electric vehicles as a mainstream solution by 2030.

title: Exponential Roadmap Initiative (ERI)
summary: Unite corporate innovators, transformers and disruptors to drive the transformation to halve global emissions before 2030 through exponential climate action and solutions.
description: The Exponential Roadmap Initiative (ERI) unites innovators, transformers and disruptors to drive the transformation to halve global emissions before 2030 through exponential climate action and solutions. The initiative is a Race to Zero partner for corporate action.

title: Fashion Industry Charter for Climate Action
summary: To drive the fashion industry to net-zero Greenhouse Gas emissions no later than 2050 in line with keeping global warming below 1.5 degrees.
description: Target 50% absolute GHG emission reductions across scopes by 2030 and net-zero no later than 2050.

title: Getting to Zero Coalition (GtZ Coalition)
summary: Drive the uptake of commercially viable zero-emission vessels operating along deep-sea trade routes by 2030.
description: The Getting to Zero Coalition is an alliance of more than 200 organizations within the maritime, energy, infrastructure, and finance sectors, supported by key governments and IGOs. The Coalition is committed to getting commercially viable deep sea zero emission vessels into operation by 2030 towards full decarbonization by 2050.

title: Glasgow Declaration on Climate Action in Tourism
summary: Accelerating climate action through the adoption of a unified action framework in the tourism sector, involving policy makers, business and civil society.
description: The Glasgow Declaration on Climate Action in Tourism presents a unified framework for tourism stakeholders to accelerate climate action and contribute to the achievement of the goals set in the Paris Agreement.

title: Global Alliance for Buildings and Construction (GlobalABC)
summary: Towards a zero-emission, efficient and resilient buildings and construction sector: Align stakeholders along the buildings and construction value chain, governments, private sector, research, civil society with the well-below 2 degree Paris Agreement Goals
description: Founded at COP21, hosted by UNEP and with 246 members, including 37 countries, the GlobalABC is the leading global platform for governments, private sector, civil society, research, and intergovernmental organizations committed to a common vision: A zero-emission, efficient and resilient buildings and construction sector. Our objectives: (1) Be a global advocate for the built environment''s importance and potential for climate action; (2) Provide a neutral platform for tracking progress; (3) Support countries based on their situation in shaping policies and setting targets, e.g. via our regional and national roadmaps.

title: Global Covenant of Mayors for Climate & Energy
summary: Combat climate change and move to a low emission, resilient society

title: Global Energy Efficiency Accelerator Platform
summary: Support action towards the SEforALL energy efficiency target of doubling the global rate of improvement in energy efficiency by 2030.
description: The Global Energy Efficiency Accelerator Platform was launched by SEforALL in 2014 to support doubling the global rate of improvement in energy efficiency by 2030. The platform is made up of Accelerators on energy efficiency sectors: buildings, lighting & appliances, district energy systems, industry and transport.

title: Global Fuel Economy Initiative (GFEI)
summary: For zero carbon vehicles globally by 2050
description: GFEI undertakes research and analysis to raise awareness about fuel economy trends, and works globally to influence policy makers to do more to improve vehicle efficiency and cut emissions.We work with countries to help them understand their own fuel economy baseline, as well as to develop fuel economy policy options. By bringing together key stakeholders GFEI also helps facilitate the policy process and support governments to implement the solutions. GFEI also provides a network for policymakers to exchange information between countries, establishing regional processes, such as in ECOWAS and ASEAN, as well as working with the G20 Transport Task Group to share information and help co-ordinate a coherent global response.

title: Global Geothermal Alliance (GGA)
summary: The GGA is a coalition for action to increase the use of geothermal energy
description: The GGA is a coalition for action to increase the use of geothermal energy, both in power generation and direct use of heat. It calls on governments, businesses and other stakeholders to support geothermal deployment and realise its full potential.

title: Global Resilience Partnership (GRP)
summary: Over 60 organisations joining forces to work together towards a world where people and places persist, adapt and transform in the face of shocks, uncertainty and change
description: The Global Resilience Partnership (GRP) believes that resilience is fundamental to the global commitment to ‘leave no-one behind’ in the 2030 Sustainable Development Goals (SDG’s). Our vision is: A world where people and places persist, adapt, and transform in the face of shocks, uncertainty, and change. We believe that resilience underpins sustainable development in an increasingly connected and unpredictable world. Under each of the four Value Additions, GRP has co-developed, with its partners, a set of Collaborative Actions (CAs). Each Collaborative Action has a corresponding set of Long Term Objectives, deliverables and activities. GRP has worked with its partners and key stakeholders to identify, co-design and catalyse these Collaborative Actions (CAs). They are designed to bring partners together to deliver greater impact and to leverage investments and the role of GRP is to connect, convene and catalyse the development and delivery of these Collaborative Actions with its partners.

title: Global Shield against Climate Risks
summary: Strengthen the resilience of developing countries and protect the lives and livelihoods of poor and vulnerable people from the impacts of disasters and climate related risks.
description: The Global Shield against Climate Risks initiative aims to provide and facilitate more and better pre-arranged protection against climate and disaster related risks for vulnerable people and countries.

title: Governors' Climate and Forests Task Force (GCF)
summary: Empower state and provincial leaders, and connect them with partners and stakeholders, to implement innovative jurisdictional programmes that protect tropical forests, promote low-carbon development, and unlock financial opportunities.
description: The GCF Task Force is a subnational collaboration of 43 states and provinces in 11 countries working to protect tropical forests, reduce emissions from deforestation and forest degradation, and promote realistic pathways to forest-based rural development. The GCF fosters partnerships with public and private sector stakeholders at multiple levels - from business and supply chain leaders to indigenous peoples and local communities.

title: Health Care Climate Challenge
summary: Mobilizing health care institutions globally to reduce their carbon footprint, build climate-resilient systems, and lead in addressing climate change.

title: High Ambition Coalition for Nature and People (HAC for N&P)
summary: Support members in the conservation and effective management of at least 30% of land and 30% of the oceans globally by 2030 to meet climate and biodiversity targets by protecting and conserving key biodiversity areas and carbon sinks.
description: The HAC for Nature & People (HAC for N&P) is an inter-regional group established to adopt an ambitious deal at the Convention on Biological Diversity COP15 including a global target of conserving and effectively managing at least 30% of the land and 30% of ocean globally by 2030.

title: High Level Panel for Sustainable Ocean Economy (Ocean Panel)
summary: The High Level Panel for Sustainable Ocean Economy is a unique initiative of 14 serving world leaders building momentum towards a sustainable ocean economy, where effective protection, sustainable production and equitable prosperity go hand in hand
description: The Ocean Panel was established to catalyse and scale bold, pragmatic solutions across policy, governance, technology and finance. The Ocean Panel continues to work towards a new ocean action agenda through a transformative set of recommendations and actions to advance a sustainable ocean economy, prioritizing a healthy ocean alongside sustainable production to benefit people everywhere. This agenda includes ambitious climate action to achieve the goals of the Paris Agreement.

title: Improved and Efficient Cooking Energy Solution for Nigeria
summary: Distribute 80 million highly efficient cookstoves to low-income and poor families across Nigeria for free.
description: Improved and Efficient Cooking Energy Solution for Nigeria Initiative aims at the dissemination and distribution of up to 80,000,000 highly efficient improved fuel wood stoves for free to women, low income, and poor families across Nigeria.

title: Industrial Deep Decarbonisation Initiative (IDDI)
summary: Aiming to deliver concrete actions in support of developed and developing countries' efforts towards decarbonizing the hard-to-abate sectors and net-zero targets by 2050
description: The Industrial Deep Decarbonisation Initiative (IDDI) works with partners to drive additional actions for the deep decarbonization of industrial sectors in developed and developing countries, by advocating for public and private procurement commitments to stimulate the demand for green products and harmonizing systems for carbon reporting and benchmarking of industrial products such as steel and cement.

title: Initiative 20x20
summary: A country-led effort that aims to change the dynamics of land degradation in Latin America and the Caribbean and seek to bring 50 million hectares into the process of restoration and conservation by 2050
description: Initiative 20x20 is a country-led effort that aims to change the dynamics of land degradation in Latin America and the Caribbean. A partnership of technical organizations supports countries in the region to develop and advance their restoration programs. Simultaneously, private partners play a complementing role as they support restoration projects through their impact-focused investments. These projects are key to Initiative 20x20 as they showcase the environmental, social and financial opportunity in restoring lands.

title: Initiative on Gender and Climate Change
summary: Climate action to recognize the differentiated impact of climate change by gender, ensure women's and girls’ agency and leadership in all climate actions and increase ambition in all sectors.
description: Climate change is threatening the global community’s gains in advancing gender equality and women’s and girls’ empowerment. Therefore, climate programmes, initiatives, and actions must empower women and engage them as actors, beneficiaries and leaders. Signatories of this initiative will work towards formulating gender-responsive climate change action plans, policies, and strategies and empowering women as leaders of climate action.

title: InsuResilience Global Partnership (IGP)
summary: InsuResilience Global Partnership (IGP) links governments, multilateral organizations, private sector and civil society to scale up Climate and Disaster Risk Finance and Insurance to protect 500 million poor and vulnerable people against climate shocks by 2025.
description: The InsuResilience Global Partnership provides a global platform for actors in the field of resilience and climate adaptation to drive the implementation of Climate and Disaster Risk Finance and Insurance (CDRFI) solutions. As such, it aims to strengthen the resilience of developing countries and to protect the lives and livelihoods of poor and vulnerable people from the impacts of disasters by enabling prearranged, predictable financing for early action, relief and recovery embedded in climate and disaster risk management strategies.

title: Intelligent Climate & Eco-Civilization Initiative
summary: Foster greater climate action, transparency of climate action, collaboration and cross-cutting among entities in China.
description: The Intelligent Climate & Eco-Civilization Initiative aims to foster greater climate action, climate action transparency, collaboration, and cross-cutting between entities in Asia.

title: International Wineries for Climate Action (IWCA)
summary: Decarbonize, by incentivising and supporting members' commitment, the wine sector by 2050.
description: The IWCA is a member-led, collaborative organization of wineries taking a science-based approach to reducing carbon emissions across the wine industry. IWCA’s member wineries are committed to the same goal: reaching Net Zero by 2050, while meeting intermediate emissions reduction targets by 2030. To support its members, IWCA offers tools and guidance on emissions reduction, accelerate learning among peers and with outside experts on climate actions strategies, and champion the voices of wineries as leaders for climate action.

title: International Zero-Emission Vehicle Alliance (ZEV Alliance)
summary: Set ambitious and achievable targets to reach the collective goal of making all passenger and medium and heavy vehicle sales in our jurisdictions ZEVs as fast as possible, and no later than 2050.
description: The International ZEV Alliance is a platform for policy experts from member governments to share challenges and develop solutions for the transition to zero-emission road vehicles.

title: Japan Climate Initiative
summary: Supporting and enhancing action to achieve a decarbonized Japanese society.
description: The Japan Climate Initiative (JCI) is a network committed to strengthening communication and exchange of strategies and solutions among all actors that are implementing climate actions in Japan. Japanese companies, municipalities, research institutions and civil society organizations that are making serious efforts towards the realization of a decarbonized society are invited to participate in the initiative and help build a decarbonized Japanese society.

title: Just Transition and Decent Jobs Pledge from the private sector
summary: Companies to ensure new jobs created in low emissions sectors are fair, decent and inclusive jobs
description: Companies pledge to comply with the following standards with respect to their employees, and only use contractors who also comply with these standards: (1) Social dialogue with workers and their unions; (2) Workers rights, including the ILO core labour standards and ILO occupational health and safety standards; (3) Social protection, including pension and health; (4) Wage guarantees, including prevailing wage rates for skilled workers in the relevant industries. Companies also pledge to support their national governments to join the ‘Advancing a Just Transition and the Creation of Green Jobs for All for Ambitious Climate Action’ initiative. And to encourage countries to support a just ecological transition by formulating national plans for a just transition and decent jobs, within which business has an important role. Objectives of the initiative are to involve private sector entities aware of how they can contribute to a just transition and committed to provide green and decent jobs in growing industries.

title: LDC-Vision 2050 and LDC Initiative for Effective Adaptation and Resilience (LIFE-AR)
summary: Support LDCs to embark on climate-resilient development pathways by 2030 and achieve net-zero emissions targets by 2050 to ensure the prosperity of our societies and ecosystems.
description: The LDC Initiative for Effective Adaptation and Resilience (LIFE-AR) is an LDC-led, LDC-owned initiative which aims to inform the development of adaptation plans; identify immediate priorities that will further build national institutions, domestic systems and capabilities; and further define National Adaptation Plans (NAPs), National Determined Contributions (NDCs) and wider national efforts to build resilience and address poverty.

title: Leadership for Urban Climate Investment (LUCI)
summary: Raise the ambition of relevant stakeholders involved in deploying finance and developing climate smart infrastructure in cities through targets and commitments; link and support initiatives that work along the entire value chain of subnational climate finance; showcase the results of initiatives targeting urban climate finance and infrastructure.
description: The Leadership for Urban Climate Investment (LUCI) is a platform for coordination and concrete collaboration between Cities Climate Finance Leadership Alliance (CCFLA) champion initiatives, helping them implement bold and effective urban climate finance targets.

title: Leadership Group for Industry Transition (LeadIT)
summary: Accelerating the transition of all industry sectors to low carbon pathways to reach net-zero carbon emissions by 2050.
description: The Leadership Group for Industry Transition (LeadIT) brings together 18 countries and 19 companies committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions from high-emitting industries by 2050. LeadIT fosters public and private partnerships to enable the necessary policy environment, finance flows, and exchange of best practice for a just and inclusive industry transition.

title: Mainstreaming Climate in Financial Institutions
summary: Support financial institutions integrate climate considerations into their different activities and operations.
description: Mainstreaming Climate in Financial Institutions helps financial institutions integrate climate considerations into their different activities and operations. The Initiative fosters the implementation of the voluntary Principles for Mainstreaming Climate Action by creating a community of professionals inside public and private financial institutions to share emerging practices including the latest methodologies, tools and their experience of implementing them; and by leading by example within the broader financial and business community, including by disseminating knowledge and lessons learned.

title: Megacities Alliance for Water and Climate
summary: Enhance capacity building on adapting to or mitigating the effects of climate change related to water in megacities.
description: The Megacities Alliance for Water and Climate (MAWAC) is an international platform for cooperation that facilitates dialogue on urban water and climate issues, with the aim of helping megacities to adapt to, and mitigate, the effects of climate change on water, through which megacities can learn from each other’s experience, exchange best practices, partner with appropriate technical, academic and financial institutions, as well as design and implement responses to the challenges related to water and climate change.

title: Mission Efficiency
summary: Drive progress on energy efficiency by scaling up narratives and solutions, supporting countries with technical and strategic assistance and investing in coordinated and actionable projects.
description: Mission Efficiency is a global collective of actions, commitments and goals on energy efficiency by a coalition of governments, organizations and initiatives.

title: Mission Innovation
summary: Catalyse action and investment in research, development and demonstration to make clean energy affordable, attractive and accessible to all.
description: Mission Innovation is a global initiative to catalyze action and investment in research, development and demonstration to make clean energy affordable, attractive and accessible to all this decade. This will accelerate progress towards the Paris Agreement goals and pathways to net zero.

title: MobiliseYourCity Partnership
summary: Incubate scalable solutions, accelerate the adoption of proven approaches, and facilitate complex change processes to transform urban mobility.
description: The MobiliseYourCity Partnership supports member cities and countries through four main service areas. Already 40.7 million euros have been raised to fund projects in these four service areas: a) Mobility planning: Supporting implementation and investment ready plans for inclusive and low-carbon transport; b) Implementation support: Empowering members to bridge planning with implementation for green and just cities; c) Capacity development: Equipping practitioners with tested and scalable solutions; d) Advocacy: Encouraging institutions and individuals to embrace and resource sustainable mobility.

title: Navigating a Changing Climate
summary: A multi-stakeholder coalition of ten associations with interests in waterborne transport infrastructure working together to support the sector as it and they respond to climate change through both adaptation and mitigation to achieve a resilient future.
description: By furthering understanding, providing targeted technical support and building capacity, the NavClimate partnership is working to enhance resilience and transition to low-carbon infrastructure in the waterbourne transport infrastructure sector.

title: Net Zero Banking Alliance (NZBA)
summary: Transition lending and investment portfolios (74 trillion USD globally, as of 05 October 2023) to align with pathways to net-zero GHG emissions by 2050 or sooner consistent with a maximum temperature rise of 1.5°C, addressing Article 2.1c of the Paris Agreement.
description: Industry-led and UN-convened, the Net-Zero Banking Alliance (NZBA) is a group of leading global banks committed to financing ambitious climate action to transition the real economy to net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050. NZBA’s framework, guidance, and peer learning opportunities support members to design, set, and achieve credible science-based net zero targets for 2030 or sooner to align with an ambition to limit global warming to 1.5 °C.

title: Net Zero Carbon Events
summary: Bringing together the event industry stakeholders to reduce the industry's greenhouse gase emissions to net zero by 2050

title: Net Zero Investment Consultants Initiative (NZICI)
summary: Support investment consultants' clients to achieve their commitment to the goal of global net-zero greenhouse emissions by 2050.
description: Launched in September 2021, NZICI is an industry-led alliance that brings together investment consultants seeking to align their operations and advisory services with the 1.5°C emissions trajectory in the Paris Agreement.

title: No New Coal Energy Compact
summary: Unite and drive the voluntary commitment of countries, and demonstrate their leadership, in participating in the global clean energy transition.
description: Launched in 2021 by Sri Lanka, Chile, Montenegro, Denmark, UK, France and Germany, the No New Coal Energy Compact Initiative represents an opportunity for all countries to unite around global net-zero goals as well as highlights their individual leadership in the just energy transition by growing energy demand alongside advancing development of sustainable energy. Energy Compacts are voluntary commitments made by a range of stakeholders on SDG7 targets in support of achieving all SDGs by 2030 as well as net-zero emissions by 2050.

title: Ocean Risk and Resilience Action Alliance (ORRAA)
summary: Drive USD$500 million of investment into coastal and Ocean natural capital by 2030, positively impacting the resilience of at least 250 million climate vulnerable people in coastal areas around the world.
description: The Ocean Risk and Resilience Action Alliance (ORRAA) is the international convenor which connects the international finance and insurance sectors, governments, nonprofits, and stakeholders from the Global South. ORRAA’s mission is to catalyse the investment of at least USD$500 million into coastal and marine natural capital through the development and deployment of finance products that build the resilience of 250 million climate vulnerable coastal people, by 2030.

title: One Planet Business for Biodiversity (OP2B)
summary: Drive transformational system change and catalyze action to protect and restore cultivated and natural biodiversity within agricultural value chains.
description: One Planet Business for Biodiversity (OP2B) is an international, cross-sectoral and action-oriented business coalition on biodiversity with a specific focus on regenerative agriculture. OP2B is determined to drive transformational system change and catalyze action to protect and restore cultivated and natural biodiversity within agricultural value chains.

title: Paris Aligned Asset Owners (PAAO)
summary: Transition member's investments to achieve net-zero portfolio GHG emissions by 2050, or sooner.
description: Paris Aligned Asset Owners are a global group of asset owners committed to transitioning their investments to achieve net zero portfolio GHG emissions by 2050, or sooner, drawing on the Net Zero Investment Framework to deliver these commitments.

title: Planet Mark Net Zero Certification
summary: Empowering organisations to solve the climate crisis

title: Pledge to Net Zero
summary: Working to commit organisations from the environmental sector to take a leadership role in the transition to a Net Zero carbon economy.

title: Powering Past Coal Alliance (PPCA)
summary: Working to advance the transition away from unabated coal power generation
description: Powering Past Coal is a global alliance of national and sub-national governments, businesses and organisations working to advance the transition away from unabated* coal power generation. Unabated coal power generation refers to the use of coal without any technologies to substantially reduce its CO2 emissions, such as carbon capture and storage.

title: Public Transport Declaration on Climate Leadership (UITP)
summary: Double the share of public transport by 2025
description: The Declaration’s goal is to double the market share of public transport by 2025 and implement over 350 pledges to climate action from more than 110 members of the international public transport community in more than 80 global cities

title: R4 Rural Resilience Initiative
summary: Ensure 1.4 million households (7.5 million beneficiaries) have access to insurance and integrated risk management tools in 25 countries by 2025
description: The R4 Rural Resilience Initiative helps vulnerable communities build their resilience in the face of increasing climate variability and shocks through an integrated set of risk management tools. The initiative provides access to subsidized microinsurance products for climate-vulnerable households that engage in risk reduction activities, such as sustainable agriculture practices, community-led disaster risk reduction and landscape restoration. To ensure the sustainability of the approach, the initiative enhances participant’s saving capacity, access to loans and to formal financial institutions, while gradually enabling farmers to pay for a portion of the insurance premium.

title: Race to Zero
summary: Rallying Non State Actors (companies - including SMEs, cities, regions, finance, educational and healthcare institutions) to take rigorous and immediate action to collectively halve emissions by 2030 and reach Net Zero by 2050 as the latest.
description: Race to Zero is a global campaign rallying non-state actors to take immediate action to halve global emissions by 2030 and deliver a healthier, fairer zero carbon world. Members joining the campaign are working to the same overarching goal: reducing emissions across all scopes swiftly and fairly in line with the Paris Agreement, with transparent action plans and robust near-term targets.

title: Race to Zero for Universities and Colleges
summary: Support universities and colleges across the world to commit to net-zero.
description: Race to Zero for Universities and Colleges is a global campaign to rally leadership and action in the education sector.

title: Railway Climate Declaration
summary: The International Union of Railways is a worldwide railway association acting as the voice of rail and convening the global railway community. The Railway Climate Declaration calls on UIC members to declare their commitment to carbon neutrality before 2050 and UN-SDGs
description: The worldwide community of railway operators and infrastructure managers were invited to commit to take a leading role in the actions to mitigate climate change by reducing their company’s carbon footprint and supporting a shift towards a more sustainable balance of transport modes. To achieve this, the community was offered to commit to: (1) Reduce my company’s specific energy consumption and CO 2 emission, and through this contribute to the UIC “Low Carbon Rail Transport Challenge” presented in 2014 at the United Nations Climate Summit, and to the Rail Climate Responsibility Pledge signed in 2015; (2) Carbon Neutrality by 2050; (3) Contribute to United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The CEOs of 35 members of the UIC have signed the commitment to Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

title: RegionsAdapt
summary: Support regional governments to assess climate change impacts, plan ambitious adaptation strategies, take concrete actions, and report on climate adaptation.
description: RegionsAdapt is the flagship climate initiative of Regions4 Sustainable Development, dedicated to advancing climate change adaptation endeavors at the subnational level, including States, Provinces, and Regions.

title: Renewables in Latin America and The Caribbean (RELAC)
summary: Achieve a regional target of at least 70% participation of renewable energy (RE) sources in the power matrix of Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC) by 2030.
description: The Renewables in Latin America and The Caribbean (RELAC) aims to track and achieve a regional target in Latin America and The Caribbean (LAC) in terms of sustainable energy. RELAC was born at the end of 2019 with the objective to achieve at least 70% participation of renewables in the region's electricity matrix by 2030 to accelerate the carbon-neutrality of electricity systems in the LAC region, improving the resilience, competitiveness and sustainability of the sector, generating green jobs, improving air quality and the health effects on its citizens.

title: Risk-informed Early Action Partnership (REAP)
summary: Make 1 billion people safer from disasters by 2025, by bringing together an unprecedented range of stakeholders across the climate, humanitarian and development communities to drive progress against our internationally-recognised 4 Targets.
description: The Risk-informed Early Action Partnership (REAP) brings together an unprecedented range of stakeholders across the climate, humanitarian, and development communities with the aim of making 1 billion people safer from disasters by 2025. It does so through mobilising commitments and inspiring action towards achieving its 4 Targets, based on its three Drivers of Change: (1) Ensuring global commitment on policy and practice; (2) Enabling country- and local-level leadership; and (3) Facilitating a marketplace for matching needs against offers of support.

title: Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi)
summary: Enable companies worldwide to do what climate science requires of the global economy: to halve emissions by 2030, and achieve net-zero before 2050.
description: The Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi) drives ambitious corporate climate action by enabling businesses and financial institutions globally to set science-based greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions reduction targets. The SBTi’s goal is to enable companies worldwide to do what climate science requires of the global economy: to halve emissions by 2030, and achieve net-zero before 2050.

title: SIDS Lighthouses Initiative
summary: Deploy renewables to enable energy system transformation in SIDS with a target of 10GW of total installed renewable energy capacity by the year 2030 for all SIDS.
description: The Small Island Developing States Lighthouses Initiative (SIDS LHI) is a framework for action to support Small Island Developing States in their energy transition efforts from fossil fuel dependence to renewables. The SIDS LHI provides a platform to share information, knowledge, lessons learned and best practices.

title: Sports for Climate Action
summary: Drive sports organizations to Net Zero emissions no later than 2040.
description: The Sports for Climate Action Initiative aims to provide sports organizations with a forum where organizations can pursue climate action in is a consistent and mutually supportive fashion by learning from each other, disseminating good practices, lessons learned, developing new tools, and collaborating on areas of mutual interest.

title: SUNx Malta Climate Friendly Travel Registry
summary: Provide a unique service to support Climate Resilience and Carbon Reduction with an initial focus on the 80% of Travel & Tourism companies who are SME's and a geographical emphasis on the world's Least Developed Countries (LDC) and Small Island Developing States (SIDS), who are particularly exposed to Climate risk.
description: SUNx Malta, a legacy to Maurice Strong - Sustainability and Climate Resilience pioneer, is a not for profit, EU based, organization, partnered with the government of Malta that has created a unique, low cost, system for companies and communities to help them transform to the New Climate Economy.

title: Tech Zero
summary: Making it as easy as possible for tech companies to understand, commit to, and reach net zero.

title: The Initiative on Climate Action and Nutrition
summary: Catalyze, mobilize, connect and advocate for integrated climate and nutrition action.
description: I-CAN is a multistakeholder, multisectoral global flagship initiative that aims to catalyze, mobilize, connect and advocate to address the critical nexus of climate change and nutrition.

title: Transformative Urban Mobility Initiative (TUMI)
summary: Mobilize technical and financial support for decision-makers to support the transformation towards sustainable urban transport
description: All around the world urban leaders, transport experts, planners or students strive to transform mobility for the better for all - we unite them. We roll out innovations on the ground, enable leaders with profound know-how and invest in the future of urban mobility. We are the leading global implementation initiative on urban mobility and we believe in a better future for humanity empowered by strong and clean mobility. We envision thriving cities with enhanced economic, social and environmental performances in line with the New Urban Agenda, the Agenda 2030 and the Paris Agreement.

title: UN-Convened Net-Zero Asset Owner Alliance
summary: Drive the transition of investment portfolios towards net-zero GHG emissions by 2050 consistent with a maximum temperature rise of 1.5°C, addressing Article 2.1c of the Paris Agreement.
description: The members of this Alliance commit to transitioning their investment portfolios to net-zero GHG emissions by 2050 consistent with a maximum temperature rise of 1.5°C above pre-industrial temperatures, taking into account the best available scientific knowledge including the findings of the IPCC, and regularly reporting on progress, including establishing intermediate targets every five years in line with Paris Agreement.

title: Under2 Coalition
summary: To empower and represent states and regions committed to reaching net zero emissions by 2050 or earlier.
description: The largest global network of state and regional governments committed to reducing emissions in line with the Paris Agreement. The Under2 Coalition brings together over 270 governments representing 1.75 billion people and 50% of the global economy. Our members commit to keep global temperature rise well below 2°C with efforts to reach 1.5°C. Over 60 states and regions have committed to reach net zero emissions by 2050 or earlier. This is essential to limit global temperature rise.

title: United for Efficiency (U4E)
summary: Increase and accelerate significantly the climate and development benefits of the Paris Agreement by increasing the global deployment of energy-efficient and climate friendly solutions for appliances and equipment with a focus on emerging and developing economies.
description: The United for Efficiency (U4E) initiative is a UNEP-led, public-private partnership, supporting developing countries and emerging economies with moving their markets to energy-efficient lighting, appliances and equipment. U4E has national projects in over 30 countries and regional initiatives in Southern Africa, East Africa, Caribbean, Southeast Asia.

title: WWF's Climate Business Network
summary: Fostering the transition of the business sector to a 1.5°C world by supporting a network of ambitious and influential companies.
description: The Climate Business Network (CBN) is a voluntary corporate network that aims to boost the ability of member companies to take action and achieve their targets.

title: Zero Carbon Buildings for All / Zero Carbon Buildings Accelerator
summary: Decarbonize the world’s building stock by 2050 through development of national roadmaps, aligned city action plans and access to finance for implementation.
description: Zero Carbon Buildings for All is a coalition of national and local actors that are aligned on enabling policies, roadmaps, and NDC commitments that will decarbonize the global building stock by 2050, in both high- income and low-income countries. The initiative includes strong representation from the private sector and financial institutions, which will dramatically enhance national climate ambition and action on buildings-related emissions. To support this effort, the Zero Carbon Building Accelerator (ZCBA) was launched in 2021 by WRI with the support of GEF and UNEP and has been working national governments in Turkey and Colombia to develop National Zero Carbon Building Roadmaps and aligned City Action Plans in two cities in each country. Though national roadmaps can provide an integrated approach to scaling zero carbon buildings and speeding up market transformation in the buildings and construction sectors, cities are where implementation and action happen and where impacts are made. In 2022 the ZCBA expanded its initiative support 6 new subnational governments in India, Kenya, and Costa Rica to develop local action plans for zero carbon building that support existing national climate and decarbonization goals. All roadmaps and action plans developed in the ZCBA identify short-, medium-, and long-term goals and actions needed for transforming the sector across the building lifecycle.

title: Business Ambition for 1.5°C
summary: Issued an urgent call to action from a global coalition of UN agencies, business and industry leaders, in partnership with the Race to Zero.
description: The Business Ambition for 1.5°C campaign is now closed. The campaign enabled companies to set robust science-based targets, and reduce emissions at the pace and scale required by climate-science. Endorsed by an unprecedented global coalition of UN agencies, business groups and industry leaders, the campaign provided a clear pathway for businesses to become credible climate leaders.

title: Climate Ambition Alliance
summary: To enhance collaboration in the achievement of net zero CO2 emissions by 2050
description: The Climate Ambition Alliance brings together countries, businesses, investors, cities and regions who are working towards achieving net-zero CO2 emissions by 2050. Country engagement in this Alliance is led by the governments of Chile and the United Kingdom, with support from UN Climate Change and UNDP; while mobilization of a non-government actors is led by the High-Level Climate Champions for Climate Action – Nigel Topping and Gonzalo Muñoz – under the ‘Race to Zero’ campaign.

title: Climate Ambition Alliance: Net Zero 2050
summary: To enhance collaboration in the achievement of net zero CO2 emissions by 2050
description: The Climate Ambition Alliance (National Pledges) commits nations to be more ambitious in their new or updated Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs), and to communicate long-term low emission development strategies (LT-LEDS) towards net-zero, as established in the Paris Agreement. It also includes firm actions on adaptation and an active participation of the private sector. All efforts aim to accelerate the necessary transformation to reach the goals of the Paris Agreement and stabilize the global temperature rise to 1.5°C.

title: Improve Water Security - Business Alliance for Water and Climate
summary: Measure and minimize risks and impacts related to water and climate change

title: Put a Price on Carbon - Business Leadership Criteria on Carbon Pricing
summary: Set an internal carbon price, publicly advocate and communicate on progress

title: Reduce Short-Lived Climate Pollutant Emissions
summary: Take action to reduce short-lived climate pollutants

title: Remove Commodity-driven Deforestation
summary: Remove commodity-driven deforestation from all supply chains by 2020

title: Responsible Corporate Engagement in Climate Policy
summary: Responsible corporate engagement in climate policy

title: Value Chain Risk to Resilience
summary: Build climate resilience in value chains by integrating climate risks into business processes and developing standard approaches for business action on resilience.
description: To build climate resilience for communities, farmers, and workers along value chains, Value Chain Risk to Resilience developed standard approaches and methodologies to support companies through the steps of building climate resilience. These include setting a climate risk management strategy; building governance; identifying, analyzing, and prioritizing climate risk; establishing response plans; and monitoring performance.

title: 2050 Pathways Platform
summary: Build climate resilience for communities, farmers and workers along value chains

title: Adaptation for Small holder Agriculture Programme (ASAP)
summary: Increase the climate resilience and food security of 8 million poor smallholder household members across the world by 2020

title: Adaptation of West African Coastal Areas (WACA)
summary: Reduce coastal erosion hotspots by 30% by 2020 and by 70% by 2025 and protect 30% of the population in priority flooding areas by 2020 and 70% by 2025 in West African coastal regions

title: Africa Renewable Energy Initiative (AREI)
summary: Scale up the Africa’s renewable energy potential to achieve at least 10 GW of new and additional renewable energy generation capacity by 2020 and at least 300 GW by 2030

title: Below50
summary: Grow the market for the world's most sustainable fuels

title: Blue Growth Initiative
summary: Reduce CO2 emissions by 10% in 5 years and 25% in 10 years and reduce overfishing by 20% in 5 years and 50% in 10 years in 10 developing countries

title: Breakthrough Energy Coalition
summary: Accelerate the development of transformative clean energy solutions by linking public research with truly patient, flexible private investments

title: Building Climate Resilience for the Urban Poor
summary: Invest USD 15.2B by 2023 and USD 60.8B by 2030 to build resilience to the impacts of climate change for 600M urban poor people in 140 cities
description: This initiative aims to help 150 million urban poor adapt to climate change in informal settlements by 2023 and to build climate resilience of 600 millions vulnerable people by 2030.

title: C40 Clean Bus Declaration/Low emission vehicles
summary: Reduce emissions from the transportation sector and improve air quality through the introduction of low and ultimately zero emission buses in fleets

title: C40 Zero Waste Declaration
summary: Reduce municipal solid waste generation, disposal to landfill and incineration

title: CCAC: Global Green Freight Action Plan
summary: Reduce emissions of greenhouse gases, black carbon, and air pollutants in the freight sector by 2025

title: CCAC: Oil & Gas Methane Partnership (OGMP)
summary: Reduce methane emissions in their operations by systematically surveying for nine key emission sources and publicly report the share of their operations being controlled for those sources

title: CCAC: Phasing Down Climate Potent HFCs / HFCs Initiative
summary: Reduce the use and emissions of high-GWP HFCs and enhance energy efficiency in the food cold chain, as well as achieve a 30-50 percent reduction in HFC emissions from refrigerant servicing within 10 years

title: CCAC: Waste, Mitigating SLCPs from the Municipal Solid Waste Sector
summary: Reduce short-lived climate pollutants (SLCPs) from the municipal solid waste sector by 2020

title: CEM: Global Lighting Challenge
summary: Deploy 10 Billion high-efficiency light bulbs as fast as possible

title: Cities and Regions' 5-year vision
summary: Accelerate action to respond to climate change by 2020 and ensure sustainable future living environments for their people

title: Climate Risk and Early Warning Systems Initiative (CREWS)
summary: Mobilize USD 100 million by 2020 to significantly increase the capacity for Multi-Hazard Early Warning Systems in SIDS and LDCs

title: Climate-Smart Agriculture Booster (CSA Booster)
summary: Pioneer the transition to climate-smart agriculture across Europe, and around the world

title: Coalition of Finance Ministers for Climate Action
summary: Action by finance ministers to assess the environmental impacts of their governments’ public portfolios
description: The President of Finland announced that Finland and Chile helped to create a coalition of finance ministers (40 members at the time of the Summit) to agree to a set of principles to systematically study the environmental impacts of their portfolios.

title: Collaborative Climate Action Across the Air Transport World
summary: Improve air transport fuel efficiency and stabilize the sector's net CO2 emissions from 2020

title: Compact of Mayors
summary: Reduce greenhouse gas emissions, report publicly and annually on progress and prepare for the impacts of climate change

title: Conference of Peripheral Maritime Regions
summary: Reduce emissions, develop sustainable energy solutions and drive efffective adaptation in Maritime regions

title: Covenant of Mayors for Climate & Energy
summary: Reduce greenhouse gas emissions by at least 20% by 2020 through the implementation of a Sustainable Energy Action Plan adopted in Council and report on progress every two years

title: Debt Swap
summary: Address the debt burden of Small Island Developing States (SIDS) while facilitating climate-change resilient economic development
description: The proposal aims at addressing the debt burden that SIDS face while at the same time facilitate investment in adaptation to the impacts of climate change and promote climate resilient economic growth. It is based on work with the Economic Commission for Latin America and the Caribbean, includes an initial pilot involving Antigua & Barbuda, Saint Lucia and Saint Vincent & the Grenadines.

title: District Energy Accelerator
summary: Acclereate the transition to low-carbon, climate resilient district energy systems

title: DivestInvest
summary: Ensure a minimum of 5% of invesment portfolios are made up of renewables and clean technology through divesting and moving assets into clean energy investments

title: Energy Storage Initiative
summary: Create a breakthrough in the battery/energy storage field and provide access to 6.5 million people mainly through solar hybrid mini grids with storage
description: Donor countries together with the World Bank Group/ESMAP in collaboration with the Climate Investment Funds (CIFs), including African Development Bank, Asian Development Bank, European Bank for Reconstruction and Development, Inter-American Development Bank launched Energy Storage Initiative with an initial $500 million in funding.

title: EP100
summary: Commit to smart energy use

title: Food Security climate Resilience Facility (FoodSECuRE)
summary: Financially and programmatically support community-centred action to build climate resilience, addressing increasing loss and damage and improving resilience building in post-disaster recovery

title: Global Alliance for Clean Cookstoves
summary: Have 100 million households to adopt clean and efficient cookstoves and fuels by 2020

title: Global Campaign for Nature
summary: Commit to conserving 30% of the Earth’s lands and oceans by 2030 and contribute to the Paris Agreement's goals through nature-based solutions
description: Group of countries committed to conserve 30% of terrestrial and marine areas by 2030 (30x30 target) and enhance the Paris Agreement's goals through nature based solutions by: (1) Creating and expanding terrestrial and marine protected areas; (2) Restoring degraded ecosystems; (3) Increasing funding for NBS, for protection and sustainable management of high ecological value ecosystems; (4) Enhance NDC by including NBS.

title: Global Initiative on Food Loss and Waste Reduction – SAVE FOOD
summary: Fight global food waste and loss by driving innovations and generating solutions across the entire value chain

title: Global Lead City Network on Sustainable Procurement (GLCN)
summary: Enable sustainable procurement practices in cities

title: Great Green Wall for Sahara and the Sahel Initiative (GGWSSI)
summary: Restore 50 million hectares of land, sequester 250 million tons of carbon and support 300 million people across the Sahel by 2030

title: Implement the Recommendations of the Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures
summary: Implement the TCFD recommendations for reporting climate-related financial information

title: International Solar Alliance (ISA)
summary: Mobilize more than USD 1 trillion of investments by 2030 for the massive deployment of affordable solar energy

title: Kwon-Gesh Climate Pledge
summary: Commit to involving our youth in our implementation of the Paris Agreement and the achievement of its goals
description: 43 Governments committed to the KWON-GESH CLIMATE PLEDGE by involving youth in the implementation of the Paris Agreement and the achievement of its goals including; (1) When putting in place climate adaptation or mitigation measures; (2) Communicating or updating nationally determined contributions; (3) Submitting or updating national adaptation communications, or; (4) Plans and communicating long-term greenhouse gas emission development strategies.

title: LCTPi
summary: Deploy business solutions to accelerate the low-carbon transition

title: LCTPi Cement Sustainability Initiative
summary: Reduce CO2 emissions from cement production and report annually on progress including independent third party assurance

title: LCTPi Renewables - REscale
summary: Support the deployment of 1.5 TW of additional renewable energy globally before 2025

title: Life Beef Carbon Initiative
summary: Reduce beef carbon footprint by 15% by 2025 in France, Ireland, Italy and Spain

title: Montreal Carbon Pledge
summary: Measure and publicly disclose the carbon footprint of their investment portfolios on an annual basis

title: Net Zero Carbon Buildings Commitment
summary: Challenge companies, cities, states and regions to reach Net Zero operating emissions in their portfolios by 2030, and advocate for all buildings to be Net Zero in operation by 2050

title: Net-Zero 2050
summary: Accelerate the transition to net-zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050

title: Oil and Gas Climate Initiative (OGCI)
summary: Reduce the collective average methane intensity of our aggregated upstream gas and oil operations to below 0.25% by 2025

title: Paris Declaration on Electromobility on Climate Change
summary: Increase electro-mobility to levels compatible with a less than 2 degree pathway

title: Planners for Climate Action
summary: Catalyze and accelerate climate action through responsible and transformative urban and regional planning practice, education and research.

title: Portfolio Decarbonization Coalition
summary: Commit to concrete and quantifiable carbon-footprinting as well as portfolio decarbonization targets

title: Promotion of Smart Agriculture Towards Climate Change
summary: Adopt agroecology practices by 25 million households in West Africa by 2025

title: Protection of 400 million Hectares of Forests
summary: Protect and sustainably manage 400 million hectares of forests in the Amazon, Central America, the Congo Basin and Indonesia

title: RE100
summary: Procure 100% of electricity from renewable sources

title: Refrigerants, Naturally!
summary: Promote a shift in cooling technology towards natural refrigerants and improve common fluorocarbon based technology

title: Resilience and Adaptation Call for Action
summary: Call for Action, which sets out commitments on responding to immediate climate impacts and to support the most vulnerable members of society and building resilient futures by putting climate risk at the center of decision making
description: Governments and institutons who have endorsed the plan commit to enhance adaptation and resilience action, particularly by: (1) Acting now to respond to immediate climate impacts and to support the most vulnerable members of society; (2) Building resilient futures by putting climate risk at the centre of decision making including by urgently increasing the availability of adaptation and resilience finance.

title: SIDS 2020 Ambition Leadership
summary: Action by Small Island Developing States (SIDS) to increase ambition in their Nationally Determined Contributions (NDC) by 2020
description: This initiative is about SIDS leading by example and playing our part in global efforts to urgently deliver more ambitious climate action, always cognizant that this ambitious action needs the support of committed partners.

title: Smart Risk Investing
summary: Increase the amount invested in smarter risk and resilience projects by the global insurance industry ten-fold to USD 420 billion by 2020

title: Statement by Financial Institutions on Energy Efficiency Finance
summary: Scale up energy efficiency financing and work with insitutional and public financiers to deploy climate finance to clients

title: States and Regions Annual Disclosure
summary: Commit to a public target to reduce region-wide greenhouse gas emissions and to report annually on progress

title: Step Up Declaration: Powering Mission 2020
summary: Reduce greenhouse gas emissions across all economic sectors and ensure a climate turning point by 2020

title: Support for Smallholder Farmers
summary: Enhance resilience to climate shocks and extreme events for 300 million small-scale farmers, increase household incomes and food security, and reverse ecological decline
description: The initiative will support 300 million small-scale farmers enhance their resilience to climate shocks and extreme events, increase household incomes and food security, and reverse ecological decline. More resilient land use will be supported and actions to drive policy reforms will be taken.

title: Task Force for Clean Energy Transition on accelerating energy transition from coal to clean
summary: Reaching the aim of 'no new coal plants after 2020'
description: The initiative will work with countries around the world to accelerate plans for new clean energy projects. It aims to bring together public and private sector leaders to share technical expertise and help make the economic case for clean energy.

title: Taxi4SmartCities
summary: Accelerate the energy transition of their vehicle fleet by 2020 and 2030

title: The 1-in-100 Initiative
summary: Adopt standards for risk evaluation to subject financial portfolios and assets to a 1-100 year stress test by 2020

title: The New York Declaration on Forests
summary: Halve the loss of natural forests globally by 2020, and end forest loss by 2030

title: Transformative Actions Program (TAP)
summary: Accelerate local and regional initiatives toward sustainable infrastructure

title: Urban Electric Mobility Initiative (UEMI)
summary: Increase sale of electric vehicles by 30% by 2030 to achieve a 30% reduction of CO2 emissions in urban areas by 2050

title: Urban-LEDS project
summary: Empower cities through low-emission development strategies to becoming green, resilient, and inclusive

title: Zero Deforestation Commitments from Commodity Producers and Traders
summary: Eliminate deforestation from the production of agricultural commodities by 2020
